review: You cannot just plug this device into the HDMI port and go.  I had to reset it several times before it would show me any networks.  I followed all the directions.  Then, once it finally connects to the internet/WIFI, it has to download the latest software.  Seriously?!  It's brand new.  How many software updates are availabe already?  At any rate, I've been at it for 35 minutes now and still haven't gotten past the software that is still updating and downloading.  I gave it two stars only because right now, I don't like it.  I may change my mind once I can finally use it.

review: I bought 2 of these because it states it supports Miracast (the ability to throw or "project" your PC to the Fire TV stick).  It just won't work between Fire TV Stick and my Lenovo Windows 8.1.  I didnt realize the Roku3 supported this as of October 2014.  It works perfectly on the Roku3, does not work at all Fire TV Stick.Not sure if I will return it.  After using the Fire TV stick for 2 day i would recommend the Roku3 over this product.  It simply has a better interface and the functionality is superior.

review: This is my first amazon TV device. The unboxing and setup was straight forward.  I was surprised that there was an included HDMI extender, which I used, in the lower end option for amazon TV. The device took some time to download the updates but I also received it the same time as a lot of other people so I assume the server(s) were getting hit pretty hard.  I activated all of my shared applications - Pandora, Netflix and Hulu plus.  The connection is seanless and its hard to believe its going over wireless.  I streamed a couple of TV shows and movies and had minimal if any lag time.  I plan on exploring the options of the device more as the weeks go on. I have heard that HBO GO maybe included in the future and that is a feature that I'm really excited about.  This device has replace my smart TV option and the family is loving it.
